PhyMediumComments: black-and-white: Ansco Superpan Press safety film
CatDescriptText: Mrs. Beatrice Jackson, 6609 Frankstown Avenue, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 11, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Do you believe youngsters in their early teens, that is from 13 to 16 years of age, should be permitted to smoke cigarettes or drink alcoholic beverages?" answer reads: "I don't think so, but what can you do? They are doing it.  I think that they are too young and besides they have a lot of time in front of them."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Beatrice Jackson wearing patterned scarf and light colored plush coat, shoulder bag slung over left arm, standing in front of brick building with store windows, one on left with shoe display, one on right with signs including "Budweiser", "Television", and "Have a Coke Refreshment through 70 years"
